Sentencas: A key need in the development of solid oxide cells (SOCs) is for electrodes that promote fast oxygen reduction and oxygen evolution reactions at reduced operating temperature (700 degrees C), with sufficient durability to allow operation over desired 40000 h lifetimes.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: A wide range of electrode materials have been investigated, with some providing resistance low enough for cell operation below 700 degrees C, but it is generally found that the electrode performance degrades over time.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: Here we demonstrate an oxygen electrode material, Sr(Ti0.3Fe0.7-xCox)O3- (STFC), that provides a unique combination of excellent oxygen electrode performance and long-term stability.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: The addition of a relatively small amount of Co to Sr(Ti0.3Fe0.7)O3-, e.g., x = 0.07, reduces the electrode polarization resistance by >2 times.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: The STFC electrode yields stable performance in both fuel cell and electrolysis modes at 1 A cm(-2).
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: The fundamental oxygen diffusion and surface exchange coefficients of STFC are determined, and shown to be substantially better than those of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-, the most widely used SOC oxygen electrode material.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: While other electrode materials have been shown to exhibit better oxygen transport coefficients than STFC, they do not match its stability.
Titulo: Cobalt-substituted SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-: a stable high-performance oxygen electrode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide electrochemical cells
